abstract: Google’s new search-within-search feature has sparked fears from publishers and retailers that users will be siphoned away through ad sales to competitors.
snippet: Google’s new search-within-search feature has sparked fears from publishers and retailers that users will be siphoned away through ad sales to competitors.
lead_paragraph: Retailers and publishers have fought hard to work their way up in the ranking of Google’s search results and refine the search features of their own Web sites to help users once they arrive. Now, Google is taking a greater role in helping users search within particular sites. And some of the same retailers and publishers are not happy about it.

headline.main: A New Tool From Google Alarms Sites
headline.print_headline: A New Tool From Google Alarms Sites

abstract: Richard Branson was lounging under the starry midnight sky on Necker Island, his palm-dappled speck of an island, recently when he asked high-powered visitors, among them Larry Page of Google, Jimmy Wales of Wikipedia and Tony Blair, the former prime minister of Britain, whther they thought global warming threatened the planet.
lead_paragraph: Richard Branson was lounging under the starry midnight sky on Necker Island, his palm-dappled speck of an island, recently when he asked high-powered visitors, among them Larry Page of Google, Jimmy Wales of Wikipedia and Tony Blair, the former prime minister of Britain, whther they thought global warming threatened the planet.

headline.main: Thinking Green, on a Private Island

abstract: Google has praised the government rules that will force Verizon to open its cellphone network to rivals. But experience suggests it may be hard to take advantage of these rules.
snippet: Google has praised the government rules that will force Verizon to open its cellphone network to rivals. But experience suggests it may be hard to take advantage of these rules.
lead_paragraph: Before Google gets too excited about open wireless access, it should look a little more closely at what did in AOL.

headline.main: When Open Access Kept the Door Closed
